Messages: Transit issues, work schedules, taking care of the family, and clinic lines can delay your visit. Get in early - get out easy!
Frequency of delivery: sent once 1 day pre-appt at 9am for 1st visit

Messages: Missing visits = missing refills and getting sick. Late visits = repeat visits in 1 week. Get in early and avoid all the hassle.
Frequency of delivery: sent once 1 day pre-appt at 9am for 2nd visit

Messages: You're doing great handling your recovery. Get in early, avoid late visits, avoid clinic lines
Frequency of delivery: sent once 1 day pre-appt at 9am for 3rd visit

Messages: Lost your phone? Get a new number? Keep us updated of your new number so we can keep you updated with your care at Bellevue

Messages: Transit issues, getting out of work or school, and lines at the clinic can delay your visit. Plan early, get in early, and get out easy! Reply "1" to reschedule your appointment.

If 1: "To reschedule, call 212-562-1082"

Messages: Avoid delays at the pharmacy. Check ur insurance to make sure its active. Need insurance? Type "1" to get enrollment information.

If 1: Call METROPLUS 1-800-442-2560 or head to the MetroPlus table in Bellevue's main lobby to get signed up

Messages: There's always ups&downs but hang in there! Stopping your sbx and relapsing on just a small amount can put you at risk of an OD. Stay solid!
Frequency of delivery: sent on day of appt at 9am for 2nd visit

Messages: Hang in there and stay healthy! Avoid mixing benzo's (klonopin, Xanax), alcohol, and sbx. Its dangerous and can lead to OD.
Frequency of delivery: sent on day of appt at 9am for 3rd visit

Messages: You've worked so hard to stay in treatment. Even a little bit of opioids can put you at risk of an OD on top of your sbx. Stay safe!
Frequency of delivery: sent on day of appt at 9am for 4th visit

Messages: Be healthy and don't risk an OD. Avoid up'ing ur sbx dose on top of alcohol or benzo's (Xanax, klonopin). Talk to your doc first.
Frequency of delivery: sent on day of appt at 9am for 5th visit

Messages: Overdoses from fentanyl are rising. Don't be a victim, don't be a statistic. Sticking with treatment saves lives!
Frequency of delivery: sent on day of appt at 9am for 6th visit

Messages: Don't let an OD take another life! Stick with ur narcan kit, get trained, and save a life. Reply "1" to get more info
Frequency of delivery: sent one day post-enrollment 12pm
If 1: "Pull off the yellow&red caps->attach the nasal piece and naloxone in the barrel->tilt head back->pray half in one nostril->if no response in 2 minutes, spray half in other nostril. Call 911!"

Messages: Get a free narcan kit from ur doctor! It saves lives! Click https://youtu.be/-t8ezZR4Xjk for a quick video on giving narcan (data usage charges may apply)
Frequency of delivery: sent once on day of appt 9am for 2nd and 7th visit

Messages: Rushing ur 1st suboxone dose can throw you into withdrawal. Wait at least 12 hours since you last used and 24 hours if you used methadone
Frequency of delivery: sent immediately after enrollment

Messages: Wait out as long as you can before taking your first dose. Reply "1" if you're feeling severe physical symptoms, reply "2" if you can still hold out
Frequency of delivery: sent 2 hours after enrollment. Then, repeat message every 3 hours until they reply with "1"
If 1: Most people feel fine with half or 1.5 tablet on day one. Give yourself 1-3 hours between each half tablet to see how you feel. ,Put half a tab or strip (4mg) under ur tongue. Give it a few minutes to set in. And don't eat or drink anything until its fully absorbed.
If 2: We'll check back in 3 hours to see how you're doing. Hang in there.
Other Notes: [post 2 hours] How are you doing? Reply "1" if you need to start suboxone, reply "2" if you can wait

Messages: Most people feel fine with half or 1.5 tablet on day one. Give yourself 1-3 hours between each half tablet to see how you feel.
Frequency of delivery: sent after replying "1" to ID 25

Messages: Put half a tab or strip (4mg) under ur tongue. Give it a few minutes to set in. And don't eat or drink anything until its fully absorbed.
Frequency of delivery: sent after replying "1" to ID 25

Messages: How are you doing? if you feel sick, reply "1", if you feel fine, reply "2".
Frequency of delivery: Send 3 hours after replying 1 to #25   --  From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: "We got you! Take another half a tablet/strip (4mg). We'll check in a few hours. If you don't feel sick or have cravings, don't take extra sbx."
If 2: "Glad the dose is helping you! Wait for a few hours and we'll check in again. Fyi, if u don't feel sick or have cravings, don't take extra sbx"

Messages: How are you feeling now? Still feeling sick? Then reply "1", if you feel fine, reply "2".
Frequency of delivery: sent 6 hours after reply "1" to ID 25    --  From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: "Okay, take another 4mg . We'll check back in a few hours to see how you're feeling."
If 2: "Great, the dose is helping. We'll check in a few hours and see how things are going."

Messages: Stick with the tx, it works! Feeling sick? Reply "1". Feeling better? Reply "2"
Frequency of delivery: Sent 9 hours after reply "1" to ID 25   --  From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: We got you! Take another 4mg and we'll check back in the morning. And fyi - Sbx kicks in about 30 minutes and lasts about 24 hours
If 2: The dose iw working! We'll get back to you in the morning. Fyi Sbx kicks in about 30 minutes and lasts about 24 hours

Messages: Good morning! You made it to day 2! Now take the total amount you took yesterday. We'll check back in a few hours and see how you're feeling.
Frequency of delivery: sent 8am day 2 post enrollment

Messages: How are you doing? Any withdrawals? If yes, reply "1". If you feel fine, reply "2".  And fyi, sbx tablets and strips work the same, but might taste different.
Frequency of delivery: sent 9am day 2 post enrollment      --  From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: "You've max'd out ur dose of sbx for this week. But being mindful of certain people, places, things, or stress, and anxiety can reduce ur cravings"
If 2: "Glad the dose is working. Being mindful of certain people, places, things, or stress, anxiety, boredom can cut your cravings"

Messages: Hope you're doing well. Are you feeling any withdrawals? If yes, reply "1". If you feel fine, reply "2"
If 1: "Take half a tablet. This is ur max dose for this week. Being mindful of certain people, places, things, or stress, and anxiety can cut ur cravings"
If 2: "Glad the dose is working. Being mindful of certain people, places, things, or stress, anxiety, boredom can cut your cravings"

Messages: Are you feeling any withdrawal symptoms now? Reply "1" if yes, Reply "2" if you're fine
Frequency of delivery: sent 12pm in day 2 post enrollment    --- From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: "Take half a tablet. This is ur max dose for this week. Being mindful of certain people, places, things, or stress, and anxiety can cut ur cravings"

Messages: Are you experiencing any withdrawals now? Reply "1" if yes, Reply "2" if you're feeling fine
Frequency of delivery: sent 4pm in day post 2 enrollment    --  From ID 28 onwards, if replied "1" 4 times (to messages #28,29,30,32) then stop sending bup doping instructions (#32,34,35) and Start sending CRAVING MANAGEMENT MESSAGES (starting at #39)
If 1: Take another half a tablet. We'll check back to see how you're doing
If 2: "Great, your dose is working out. We'll be sending you some messages to help you manage ur cravings"

Messages: You made it now to day 3! Take the total amount you took yesterday. If you feel too tired or sleepy, cut down your dose by 4mg. We'll check back in a few hours and see how you're feeling.
Frequency of delivery: sent 9am day 3 post enrollment

Messages: On to the day 4! Avoid adjusting your dose and take the amount you took yesterday. Reply "1" if ur feeling sick or need help from ur suboxone doc
Other Notes: We're here for you! Send a text to 917-XXX-XXXX and your suboxone doctor will get back to you Mon-Fri between 9-5pm.

Messages: Do you still have urges or cravings to use? Reply "0" for none, "1" for a little, "2" for somewhat, and "3" for a lot.
If 1: "Reply ""1"" if these urges are due to withdrawals, ""2"" if they're from anxiety or feeling down, ""3"" stress or boredom, or ""4"" cuz of people/places/things?"
Other Notes: Great! Glad the treatment is working for you

Messages: Don't take more than 2 tabs per day. If ur feeling withdrawal symptoms? Reply "1" to talk to your doctor and get the right meds to keep you comfortable
If 1: We're here for you! Send a text to 917-XXX-XXXX and your suboxone doctor will get back to you Mon-Fri between 9-5pm.

Messages: Still feeling cravings? Reflect on those people, places, things, or stressful situations that might be ur trigger.
Getting onto a stable dose of sbx might take a few days, but it'll work! Be patient, you're doing great!
Don't take more than 16mg in one day. But if you need more, talk to your doc first. Reply "1" to get tips and other meds to get rid of any bad symptoms
Other Notes: We're here for you! Send a text to 917-XXX-XXXX and your suboxone doctor will get back to you Mon-Fri between 9-5pm.

Messages: Stay strong! You're doing great. Reflect on what things inspire you to stay clean.
You've put in so much to stay in treatment. Keep focused. It works, saves lives, and helps patients bounce back, work, and rebuild their lives!
Don't get bored and risk use. Get out of the house, find a meeting, meet sober friends, exercise, anything to get your mind off of it.
How are you doing? If you feel like it's getting too much and might use, reply "1" to talk with our doctor or counselor. We're here for you!
Other Notes: We're here for you! Send a text to 917-XXX-XXXX to get our counselor or suboxone doctor Mon-Fri between 9-5pm.

Messages: What reasons got you into treatment in the first place? Now what things motivate you to stay in treatment and make it work?
What got you to quit? Take a moment and think on it. You know you can do it!
Have urges to use? Getting stressed? Don't let anxieties amp up your cravings. Reply "1" to get some relaxation techniques and cool it off.
Avoid certain people, places, things that make u use. And take a minute and reflect on positive people, places, things that can get u through this!
Don't want to get locked up, lose your money, and go through withdrawals again. Stick with the treatment, it works!
Find positive distractions! For urges and cravings, take a walk in the park, take a deep breath, say a prayer, call a friend, do something fun! You can do it!
Another text from your doc @Bellevue. We're here every Monday and Tuesday 9-12pm for you. keep up the good work!
Ask yourself "When I have urges, cravings, or a physical needs, what 3 easy actvities will help me stay clean?"
Ask yourself "When I have urges, cravings, or a physical needs, what 3 people help motivate me to stay clean?"
Avoid people, places, things that can worsen ur cravings. Sticking with the sbx, clinic visits, and meetings will keep you solid!
What else helps you get through the day? Exercise, calling a friend, dancing, music? Switch ur routines and enjoy your sobriety!
Reflect on what it takes to stay clean. "When I have urges, cravings, or a physical needs, which 3 places can I go to which can help me to stay clean?"
Don't get bored and risk use. Get out of the house, find a meeting, meet sober friends, exercise, anything to get your mind off of it.
Take a moment and reflect: "The two most important reasons I want to stay clean are...?"
Take a minute and reflect: "By staying sober, I hope to experience and enjoy these two things..?"
Reflect on what it takes to stay clean. "When I'm stressed or anxious, what 3 things can I do instead of using?"
Reflect on what it takes to stay clean. "When I see people around me using, what 2 easy things can I do to get my mind off it?"
This is your doc @Bellevue. Take it one day at a time. Every day on treatment is a step forward. Stay focused! You can do it! See you soon
Stick with the program. It works. Don't give in to cravings. The consequences can be a lot worse.
You don't have to use today. Hold on, someone cares. Call a friend, go to a meeting, link with our clinic counselors.
There's help out there; Be around people that are supportive.
Stay true to yourself. Allow someone like a family member to help you take your medication.
Stay busy. Go to group meetings, do activities or exercises that make you feel better,
Don't give in to cravings, stop before it's too late. Think how much better you'll feel in a few days.
Stay strong - Stay focused - Never give up - Hang in there!
How're you doing? If you ever have thoughts about using, come to clinic or contact our counselors
This is your doctor, hope you're doing well and see you soon.
Stay away from people, places, and things that can get in the way of your recovery. You've worked too hard for this.
You put a lot of time to get here, don't forget what you've been through.
Take your meds, stick with your appointments, keep in contact with your support network - it can only get better
There's help out there. Be around people, meetings, and counselors that are supporting your recovery.
Get out of the house, do community service, exercise, get your mind off it
Take it one day at a time, take it slow.
You're doing great; Keep up the good work; Send congratulatory messages.
It's easier to stay clean than to get clean. You don't want to get HIV, Hepatitis, or get arrested.
You know you're important to us. We're here to support you.
Be around positive people. Find someone you can talk to.
It get's better, no more being sick.
Don't change your routine, Stick to it.
You're not cured yet. If you feel like relapsing, reach out for help.
Taking extra sbx won't help ur anxiety or stress - get real help! Talk to your doc or reply "1" to get a visit with our walk-in Psychiatry clinic
Frequency of delivery: sent at 12pm
If 1: "Call 212-562-8856 or walk-in anytime to C-building, 2nd floor for an initial visit"

Messages: Suboxone helps you stay clean! Click on this 2 min video URLï¿½.LINK to get more info on how it works and possible side effects (Data usage costs may apply)
Frequency of delivery: sent at 12pm

Messages: Don't exceed your daily dosage, be mindful of when the desire to exceed your dosage occurs.
Frequency of delivery: sent at 12pm

Messages: Keep a schedule, take your meds on time. Don't take it when you feel like it.
Frequency of delivery: sent at 12pm

Messages: Stick with the meds! Sbx is safe with most anti-retrovirals. Talk to your doc to get more info.
Know your viral load, CD4, Genotype? Get tested, get your results.
Need more help? Bellevue can help you with depression, HIV, Hep C services. Ask your doc to get started on treatment
Text the Dept of Health @ 877-877 and type "testnyc" for free HIV testing or "care" for HIV treatment options.
Get cured, stay on your antiretrovirals. Take them at the same time each day, use a calendar, pill tray, phone alarm, or ask friends/family to remind you.
Can be tough remembering to take your meds every day. Talk to your doc if you're feeling side effects, sick or depressed, or losing motivation in ur tx.
Feel good and get treated! Sticking with ur meds helps. If you forget them, tell your doc asap.
Sticking with meds and appts can be hard for some. Get help from ur family and friends. Reply "1" to link with other people in tx supporting each other through this.
Hitting a rough moment? Talk to others who've  been in your shoes. Reply "1" to get 1800 numbers for NA and SMART recovery groups and talk with someone who gets you.
Other Notes: For NA, call 212-929-6262 and check out SMART recovery here http://www.smartrecovery.org/

Messages: Feeling bored, alone, or frustrated? Link with SMART recovery groups to help you build and maintain the motivation to stay clean, coping with urges, and living a balanced life. Reply "1" for more info
Other Notes: Click here for SMART online forums https://www.smartrecovery.org/community/ and meeting schedules https://www.smartrecovery.org/community/calendar.php

Messages: Tap into your support network! Friends, family, church groups.. Need more help though? Check out 12 step or SMART recovery groups for individual and group support. There's people who can help!
What some more tips to stay clean and in treatment? Link up with our CDOP counselors just next to our sbx clinic. Reply "1" to get more information.
If 1: "Call 212-562-4487 or walk-in anytime to XX building, XX floor for an initial visit"

Messages: If you put your mind on it, you can do it. Sometimes an extra push can go a long way. Reply "1" to get support and linked with our CDOP counselors.

Messages: These first weeks are crucial. And we're here for you. Combining sbx with outpatient counseling can make a difference! Reply "1" to get try out a session with our counselors.

Messages: Sometimes it's the small steps that are the most helpful. Linking with NA or AA, SMART groups, volunteering, exercising, more time with the fam, church, art, music, sports - enjoy your sobriety!!
Stay positive, you've made it into treatment! Link up with NA, AA, SMART groups, friends or family. Getting tips from others can be a big help. Reach out!
You're not alone. People care about you. Reach out to NA or AA, SMART groups, church groups, supportive friends or family, and our clinic staff.
Stay active with other people in recovery.
